Name: Happiness
Review:
I‚Äôm gonna be blending both of the reactions I had for this movie: agreeing this to be one of the best dark comedies out there and the other believing it to be too twisted and cynical to be classified as something for entertainment purposes.
Honestly, I was so uncomfortable¬†watching this movie and I think the main reason is because of how real it felt: the family felt real, the events were tragic but definitely based on reality, and how these situations and characters could be present in your own life without you knowing.¬†
Was I satisfied with the movie as a whole? Yes, I think. None of the scenes seemed out of place and for the runtime being more than two hours, that is kind of cool.¬† NOTE: The scene before the title sequence is probably the best way to capture how the rest of the movie will pan out: starting innocently enough until the shift comes where suddenly the whole thing turns to üí©.

Name: The Devil Wears Prada
Review: Both Emily from Emily in Paris and Andy from Devil Wears Prada are at the same level of oblivious when it comes to their job, but Andy is just more charismatic about it. Something that caught most of my attention for the film was the progression of Andy's outfits and how well put together all the outfits were for the characters. It made the Runway Fashion environment much more believable and the scenes held much more power like when Miranda gives Andy that spiel about that cerulean blue sweater (Andy at the beginning of the movie definitely gave "not like other girls" energy). The whole movie just felt very believable and that's all I ask for. I've seen better plot twists in other movies but since I felt connected to all the characters involved, this one had me feel equally as betrayed. NOTE: John Krasinski was right about this being one of his wife's best acting roles.
Tags: anne hathaway, meryl streep, emily blunt, comedy

Name: 10 Cloverfield Lane
Review:
I was not ready for the Cloverfield universe and don‚Äôt think I ever will be.
First thing I noticed was how much character and details the set had (which is very important considering we are in one place for most of the movie and IMO the reason why Split and The Room wasn‚Äôt as good as it could have been but then again they have diff goals with their sets). And with all the little details on set, the movie makes sure to make a call back to all the little things like a picture frame, utensils, and even a board game. I wonder if the attention to detail is the director‚Äôs input and why he is so famous.
No one would be able to guess the ending of this movie and it‚Äôs just something you have to go blind to (like I did). The only reason why it‚Äôs not 5 stars is because of one specific scene, but I won‚Äôt spoil. I‚Äôm reading the reviews on here and there‚Äôs a lot of praise for John Goodman or ‚Äúthe creepy bunker guy.‚Äù I personally did find myself being scared of the unpredictability of his character and had me physically cringe at some of the things he did. I‚Äôm not really someone that knows a lot about acting but maybe I‚Äôll watch some more movies he stars in.

Name: Sound of Metal
Review:
I can't say that this movie really amazed me or even was worth my time. However, I can still appreciate it for what it is even if the story was a little bland for my liking‚Äî a tough, apathetic guy is given some burden where he has to hang out with outcasts only to then self-reflect on who he formerly was and can now mature into the best version of himself. Sounds like A Walk to Remember but instead of Mandy Moore it‚Äôs a little deaf schoolboy?

It felt predictable all the way through and nothing in this movie had me go "wow, good on them for changing the narrative in a way I couldn't expect" so that is why this gets a not-so-high but earnest rating. 

What did I like about this movie: the scene where Ruben has to cut ties with the deaf house is the best scene because it shows the climax of Ruben's selfishness and I'm glad Joe put him in his place. I think it's good that we didn't have to see him saying goodbye to anyone when he left cause I don't think he deserved a proper farewell anyway from the housemates.

Name: (500) Days of Summer
Review:
Probably my favorite opening for any movie just because of the song that plays in the background during the montage. 

It's easy to hate Tom because of how down bad he is for Summer especially in the earlier days, but what this movie does well is portraying how humans are complicated and all Tom was doing was learning that the many people that come in and out of your life may only b lessons rather than your soulmates.

Name: Girl, Interrupted
Review: This one's for Angelina Jolie's micro bangs

Name: Barbie: A Fashion Fairytale
Review: Can‚Äôt believe all movies made after 2010 were brave enough to show their faces when this released

Name: Little Miss Sunshine
Review:
This is the best family coming-of-age movie I've watched and I saw Minari. 

One thing that prevents this from being a 5/5 is there wasn't enough attention on the mom; mom definitely had issues just like the rest of them but wasn't given enough screentime to air out her dirty laundry on what those were.

It's not until the closing scene came that I realized how attached I was to the Hoover family. After watching them drive 800+ miles, you start to feel like you're in that car as well.

NOTE: The pilot episode for Toddlers and Tiaras (2009)

Name: In the Mood for Love
Review:
This is more a collection of thought-out, beautiful screen captures than an actual movie. The best aspects were the shots where half of the frame is half cluttered with the apartment's belongings, conveying the atmosphere well and how busy and crowded Hong Kong can be.

I didn't care for the characters much, so most of the plot was lackluster for me. I wish that I liked this more.

Name: Hoop Dreams
Review: Young spike lee being in this was a pleasant surprise

Name: Thirteen
Review: I'm now more scared of teenagers than I was before

Name: Following
Review:
Exciting in the beginning, a little confusing in the middle (TBF I left in the middle and then resumed watching at the 30 min mark), but the ending makes me want to watch it again. 

This film reminds me of what it was like watching Fight Club, and I really thought this was directed by David Fincher (random details that are overlooked until they come together in the end, meta dialogue, how some scenes r shot). If Christopher Nolan is anything like David Fincher, then I should probably look more into his work.

The time jumps and the a-ha! moments were not as fleshed out as I think they could have been, probably because the film is so short.

Name: Fish Tank
Review:
This was OKAY, I've watched better coming-of-age movies and don't think this is one I'd recommend.

But this movie felt very real from the amateur dancing that looked like it was learned from London street dancing videos to dialogue between toxic, hot-headed family members. I was rooting for Mia for most of the movie and thought she made a good protagonist. 

Is it called fish tank cause she feels constrained in the town she's living in and that's why she leaves to Wales? Is it cause she's a fish out of water? But then why not name it a fish bowl? Is she ACTUALLY the fish, what if it's Connor or her mom or sister?


NOTE: OH sh!t this is the same director of American Honey.

Name: The Night of the Hunter

Name: Successful Alcoholics

Name: Pretend That You Love Me

Name: I Want to Eat Your Pancreas
Review: Saw someone on tiktok crying HARD at this movie so I was ready for this to be the next Your Name or Kimi no na wa. . Then I realized nothing will b the next Kimi no na wa. Predictable and reminded me of the movie Then Came You, but Then Came You took itself a lot less seriously. Since Then Came You wasn‚Äôt trying to force you to care about the characters and their ‚Äústruggles‚Äù it made it a much more enjoyable watch while THIS was definitely trying to make me feel bad for the main character guy when he really was just a boring piece of plywood.¬† If this was a live action it definitely would not have this high a rating, but alas anime does make everything look and seem better

Name: The Squid and the Whale
Review:
The first movie Jesse Eisenberg acted in that has now type casted him as the anal know-it-all

I'm not usually a person that notices great acting and don't even have a favorite actor that comes to mind, but the characters here were so unbelievably annoying that it was hard to step back and realize that this wasn't a real family I was spying on. 

Noah Baumbach creating this AND marriage story is crazy and it goes to show how introspective his story telling is. 

I personally would have liked the squid and the whale metaphor to be a little more fleshed out just because I believe that the rest of the movie was SO good that the reference at the end was a little malnourished? Lacking.

Name: The Girl from Hunan
Review:
Only 7 reviews? Yeah I only watch REAL underground films

I feel like this movie could have DEFINITELY been shorter and by the end of it, I didn‚Äôt even feel connected to any of the characters except Chun Guan the ‚Äúbrother.‚Äù I knew Hua Goa was a deadbeat when the first thing he thought when seeing Xiao Xiao was her boobs, Xiao Xiao was a boring protagonist all she did was accept her fate as a nanny to bring her husband which understandable cultural conformity but ü•±, and the village ppl were boring as well. 

Only reason why I‚Äôm giving this a 3 instead of a 2 is because this was made a while ago, and old movies are known to suck anyways. Wes Anderson once said ‚ÄúAnything made before The Social Network can be tossed üóë.‚Äù

Name: Panic Room
Review: The scenes where they thought screaming for help in the panic room made me LOL But all in all I would have not been able to survive this escape room puzzle, 4 key room difficulty

Name: Squid Game
Review:

The only lesson I got from this show was that I would die INSTANTLY unless there was a squid games for ipad kids, and I can count every street alley game I‚Äôve ever played in one hand.


How would a deadly game of hopscotch look

Name: Please Stand By
Review: Did not finish, so this review = in conclusive. I think her pretend movie script was more interesting than the actual movie.

Name: All Too Well: The Short Film
Review: It served its purpose.

Name: Kids
Review:
Literal shit is what this movie is. I thought I hated Harmony Korine after watching half of Gummo and now can say that I definitely hate at least one of his movies in full length. 

Watching this did not feel like a 'scope into the lives of NY street kids' but more like 'how am I going to root for Jennie for the whole movie and nothing but BAD things are going to happen to her???' Any hope that you have for this movie DIES. 

How is it that this is movie supposed to be a conversation about teenage unprotected sex and HIV when our antagonist is getting more screentime for his dumb sex escapades than our protagonist??? Face it: Larry Clark was more interested in filming Telly getting it on with a 13-year-old girl than any lesson that Jennie was trying to learn from all this.

The only interesting scene here was the girls vs guys sex talk, after that is just prepubescent porn and major sexual assault cases happening. Things that are disturbing just for the sake of being disturbing is all Harmony Korine is good for. 

The ethics in this movie are also quite concerning since Casper did some major method acting in this film (someone who was never a real actor to begin with and literally lived this story) While Casper or Justin Pierce has full autonomy of his actions and no one else, it makes watching this just so uncomfortable and people that enjoyed this movie questionable.

Name: Spring Breakers
Review:
Never have I ever!!! picked up my phone so much during a movie and out of all harmony Korine movies, I didn‚Äôt expect spring breakers to be the most boring one. 

The premise was so lost within this movie (girls going to the dark side in order to continue partying and ignoring their wasted life + potential) because I thought I‚Äôd see the most character development and story in here, but all it did was let me down. 

Way too many threesome scenes to actually keep the story going, what a shameless wanker that Korine is.

This is one of Korine‚Äôs least fan‚Äôs favorite movies but after watching his fan‚Äôs most favorite (KIDS), I think they only hated this movie cause it didn‚Äôt have enough ambiguous empty space for them to interpret whatever crap they wanted to take away from it.¬†This movie really just spells everything out for you, one of the most brain-dead scripts ever like how many times can they say ‚Äúmother fucker‚Äù before I start believing it‚Äôs not a real word. So cringe.

Name: Gummo
Review:
The ending was kinda beautiful (minus the dead cat), I liked the ending song. 

This film was less harmful than Kids and more interesting than Spring Breakers, so sure! this one is probably the best one that I like out of Harmony Korine's set even though I definitely spaced out after the 1-hour mark. 

Repetitive, boring scenes. The thing is that the dialogue doesn't match up with whatever message Korine is trying to send, therefore I can never find anything deep within Korine's movies/films. Just because you get white people to use the n-word and film it on a kodak camera doesn't mean that it "so raw and authentic and genuine." Alas, for someone that was clearly spiraling behind the scenes with his own issues.. this is a fine end result. 

The only scenes that evoked any emotion in me were the sisters defending their other sister from the old pervert in the car and the spaghetti bathtub scene (when his crunch bar fell in that bathtub, I wanted to end my life right there).

Name: Amanda Knox
Review:
How was the conclusive motive for Amanda Knox brutally murdering Meredith Kercher 'a slut shaming comment that went too far'.. how disconnected do you have to be from a woman to think that this how how they behave?

"Amanda Knox was a girl that was seen kissing her boyfriend near the crime scene and then got instantly pinned as the psychopathic mastermind behind Kercher's murder." 
- This is definitely a conclusion that a sexist journalist would make before scoffing at the fact a young girl could have casual love affairs

Name: Licorice Pizza
Review: While this is a grooming story, I don‚Äôt think you have to hate it for that reason because movies are not meant to b moral compasses anyway and the only goal, I‚Äôd say, for a movie is, ‚Äúwas it entertaining?‚Äù I also think it was smart to place the movie in the 70s since we have to play into how illegal relationships like these were kinda normal in day-to-day life. If this was set in today‚Äôs then we‚Äôd b allowed to b like ‚Äúthis is not realistic at all! No one would have let this happen!‚Äù Just based on their looks it was a really good cast selection, I like how PTA didn‚Äôt find stunning people that would distract the audience from how messed up these characters really are.¬† The girl is hopeless and trying to chase back her youth because she‚Äôs sad about how much of a loser she has become while the kid has everything going for him and his only real setback is that he is only 15. The power imbalance at face value is the woman being 25 and the boy being 15. As you keep watching, you start to realize this isn‚Äôt your typical 15 year old and not a fully grown 25 year old. You see how the woman is lost in who she is and that she actually relies¬†on the kid which is pretty sad and once he starts realizing that too, the roles start to shift (or were they ever shifted in the first place?)
Tags: pta, alana haim, cooper hoffman, theatre, hotdog3

Name: Mommy
Review:
How can in a second, Steve can make me go, 'what a little shite >;0' to 'poor baby is misunderstood ;(' ??? The acting in this is CRAZY good coming from D.I.E and Kyla too. The fight scene between Steve and Kyla made Marriage story's fight scene look like a middle school theatre improv routine

The movie is tragic then beautiful then hopeless then hopeful. I LOVE THE SQUARE RATIO ASPECT. Every time it went to normal rectangle size, I realize how much empty space other movies have when it is in that ratio. Bring back the square movies, I don't need the white noise in the background.

The only part that I wish had more to it was the ending or maybe I just never wanted the movie to end. The scene between Kyla and D.I.E at the end was a little too long for me and thought it was too predictable that Steve escaped (why would you EVER take that kid off his straitjacket??). The movie sort of came from too high of a high that it was destined to fall.

Review: EXTREMELY MID

Name: BlacKkKlansman
Review: The ending gave me the same punch to the gut as Dear White People did. I would be embarrassed as hell to live in Charlottesville after seeing this. I almost like how anti climatic and unsatisfying the resolution was. The bad guys get blown up and.. that‚Äôs it. The city is no different, they don‚Äôt even get to know¬†that something this evil was lurking in their neighborhood. Because the racism is not over, and movie Ron Stallworth still has a lot to do before he can have his heroic sayonara.

Name: Girl 6
Review: Sure.. was it a lazy ending? Were there boring side plots throughout 1/4 of the movie? Did the dramatic shift take too long? Maybe. But did Girl6 make the life of dropping everything to work their way up to the top of the 'call girl' hierarchy look glamorously depressing? ABSOLUTELY.

Even though I knew how scummy Mikey was to literally everyone, the most hopeless feeling rained over me when he told Lexi he was going back to California. It was an¬†I hate you but now I‚Äôm just disappointed in how little you‚Äôve learned from our time together¬†moment. The director of Tangerine, how could he disappoint?

Name: tick, tick...BOOM!

Name: Frozen
Review:
Context: watched this at 2am on the last day of my ski trip

In a survivalist horror movie, I care way less about having developed characters and more about what their out-of-the-box solutions are for a bizarre situation. So, why did I watch 1 hour of listening to these obnoxious idiots' sob stories and 30 minutes of them jumping off the ski lift thinking this was their best solution??? If I was stuck up there with them, I would

1. Use my skis/snowboard to zipline down to chair to chair
2. CALL SOMEONE?? I use my phone all the time when I'm on these ski lifts, did they think when the lights were off the cell phone towers were too? What was that running joke of Lynch remembering that phone number for, was it a tease at a possible solution they just forgot to write in the script?
3. WHY WAS THE GIRLFRIEND EVEN GOING UP THE MOUNTAIN WITH THEM? WASN'T SHE ALREADY ASS AT THE BUNNY HILL?? If she had just stayed down at the lodge, she would have noticed them taking forever and would have eventually figured out they were in trouble

Name: King Richard
Review:
I don't think I had a favorite biopic until now. 

There were moments I understood King Richard completely even when all was against him and then moments where I contemplated on whether his stubbornness (and maybe even envy) guided his choices before anything else. But that goes to show why this movie is named after King Richard (Not Venus or Serena or even the Williams family) and why he is one of the greatest protagonists I think I've seen this year. 

The gangster subplot -yes, I think should have been there- After the first encounter with them, I felt uneasy every time the family went to the tennis courts after and that must have been their reality as well (the real Williams family). And the mixed emotions that ran over me when the drive-by shooting scene happened. Because you realized then that everyone is running away from someone and that those guys had bullies of their own they had to deal with.

Name: Lady Bird
Review:
Me 26 minutes in: ü•± Me 27 minutes in with the sewing machine and thanksgiving dress: ü•∫ Me when the counselor said
‚ÄúDon't you think maybe they are the same thing? Love and attention?‚Äù
and then CUT TO them in the thrift store trying out dresses AGAIN: üò≠üò≠üò≠ It‚Äôs clear to tell which parts of the movie Lady Bird is dressing herself, but then there are those clearer moments of when Lady Bird is getting her dresses picked by her mom.. which is when I SOB! Her dad was right in them both having strong¬†personalities that they don‚Äôt know how to handle each other. Her mom demonstrating her love through her craft and care towards dresses that Lady Bird would wear in big events in her life like her first away- thanksgiving and prom is such a beautiful way of ¬†demonstrating their mother-daughter relationship. I felt like I was fighting for my life from the airport scene and onward.¬† Rewatch hit different, this movie went from a 3/5 to a 5/5

Name: Scenes from a Marriage
Review: How we get to the place where we scared to talk softness to each other? - Raisin in the Sun A relationship so toxic where both parties are so insecure within , that they can only become vulnerable with each other when they are separated or participate in infidelity together (out of pride). Both as a couple and as separate individuals, the characters start as imperfect and ends as imperfect with one of the ending lines being, we love each other in an earthly and imperfect way. The only reason I could root for these two throughout the movie is because of how self aware they are in how dangerous they become together.. yet proceed to repeat the whole process 5x over :/// As for entertainment value, I did find myself needing a break in the middle and wishing for the movie to end around the 2hr mark. But I also don't regret the time I put into watching this movie either.

Name: The Farewell
Review: Prior college me watched this and felt NOTHING at the hospital gown coughing scene, earring scavenger hunt, family walk out, and the ending scene. Truly, barely, a real human. This movie was so weird in how it was feelings of nothing, nothing, nothing BOOM! nothing, nothing, BOOM! and then the end. Death didn't feel like a narrator, but family did. All throughout the movie, we see the whole family eating, celebrating, living together. It's not until we see the family walking out the hospital without Nai Nai that we realize that they hadn't been too good to each other in the past, but they know now that their family will make it, even after Nai Nai's death I can barely explain why I felt so much at the end of this movie when other parts, I thought I was going to fall asleep. And why was Awkwafina's 10 second piano scene literally perfection? How did I watch this in theatres two years ago and not remember anything? This and reading David Sedaris' book The Best of Me is too much to handle and makes me want to grow old too, so I can experience what they r talking about.

Name: La Strada

Name: Nope
Review: Needed more screen time of MINARI DADDY !!¬† The music scoring in this movie was perfect; I‚Äôve never felt more seduced, captivated, and clenched watching a movie. Even the last crazy theatre experience (EEAAO) I had didn‚Äôt have me completely tunnel vision like this movie did for the last 30 minutes. I would say the horror was exactly where it needed to be: no jump scare felt cheap, that chimp is one of the most villainist villains ever (CLEVER! is how Peele put the chimp cold open and THEN the Monkey Paw Productions¬†logo right after) and I truly was scared to walk back to my car.. and didn‚Äôt look up once My first Peele experience and you better PEELE-IEVE this won‚Äôt be the last! What I can say is that his world building is what I find truly unique; this movie feels the closest to replicating the experience of reading a book. Of course, some movies can just feel¬†like movies but what Peele did in this movie was mystifying

Name: American Promise
Review:
It‚Äôs crazy that boyhood and American promise were essentially filmed at the same time, how did these two random directors think,‚Äù yeah, 2002 is a good year to start a 14 year long project.‚Äù I‚Äôm actually a 2002 19 year project that‚Äôs still going on!

A glimpse into motherhood is what I felt in this documentary: that every child is crazy special but insanely ordinary at the same time. That you can think your child is Obama, doesn‚Äôt mean that they are POTUS but they are YOUR Obama and that‚Äôs all that matters. Name: Enron: The Smartest Guys in the Room
Review:
For markets and morality class

UGH! STUPID HEDGE FUND INVESTMENT STOCK JARGON! I DONT KNOW WHAT ANY OF THIS EVEN MEANS! ¬†Why didn‚Äôt they recommend a prerequisite documentary to this called ‚ÄúWall Street for dummies.‚Äù¬†

I don‚Äôt get it, I don‚Äôt want to get it, people aren‚Äôt evil, the system is. And when I say the system, I don‚Äôt mean capitalism. I mean competition but that doesn‚Äôt mean greed and that doesn‚Äôt mean markets because those don‚Äôt go hand in hand. But capitalism did intensify competition but they still aren‚Äôt the same. And maybe Marx was right. But Marx is also only suitable in a world without civilization and society so that wouldn‚Äôt work either. And why would I keep my retirement funds in a 401K and not 20 feet ¬†under my basement which is only accessible through a shovel and a key to the treasure chest.

But I also have a lot of hope for upcoming cinema because of how strangely familiar this felt to watching everything everywhere all at once. Weird but fantastic.

Name: Babylon
Review:
Watched with hannahbananamontana

This is the first time I've watched a movie and within the first few minutes, been stressed about what the budget must have been. 

That scene where someone is consoling Jack Conrad on his failed acting career. How the greatest gift that fame can give to an actor is not a long career but to have them seen even beyond their time. Not that they are idolized, beautified- but seen.

Then that ending... where Manny watches movie Nellie and sobs as he sees they are making fun of her; movie Nellie messes up her lines, is clumsy, has an ugly New Jersey accent. But then he smiles. By then, he realizes they both had accomplished exactly what they wanted: Nellie's death may just be a corner story in the newspaper but is still on the front page, people learn of who Nellie was on the screen even after she already died. Movies aren't meant to last forever and Manny is no longer a producer. 

Does anyone else think this movie was meta? It's saying how hollywood isn't meant to last forever.. while being a three hour hollywood movie! MAN! If that's not a forever time to sit in the theatre, then I'm afraid.

IF ANYONE INTERRUPTS THIS SCENE AGAIN, I WILL SHIT ON YOU. I WILL SHIT ON YOUR HEAD.

Review:
The irony that this murderer that killed a journalist was taken down in court by this documentary made by a journalist is probably the closest thing to justice- it's hard to believe that this whole story is REAL. The events and aha moments played out like a movie.

He definitely... had some warning signs about him.. his evil villain monologue at the END! BRUH! No man is charismatic enough to basically tell me he's a psychopath, and then get away with it!

Name: Boiling Point
Review:
There's just so much that happens in a restaurant that makes for such a good movie: front of the house, back of the house, whose taking care of the oysters, did they write down the peanut allergy for table 4, when did those food critics get their meal, did they get that off-the-menu steak??? 

The resilience it takes to be a server is resilience that you forget about until you're a server again. Much like most shitty jobs. I'm not very patient now, but I would be a LOT LESS patient if I didn't work those jobs. 

The only 2 times I've ever heard someone cry in a bathroom were during my 2 food service jobs. This movie was too real.

AND IT BEING ONLY 1.5 hours long, WHAT A BLESSING! Movies need to be 1.5 hours long now, with the exception of EEAAO.

Name: La La Land
Review: My favorite scene was Emma Stone doing that audition scene with the phone call. I didn't care for much else.

Name: Where the Crawdads Sing
Review:
Fell asleep an hour in. 

I came for a murder mystery. I came to see a freak marsh girl that grew algae out of her punani and spoke to swamp monsters. I wanted to see the most brutal bullying treatment a small conservative town could throw. 

And then what I got was a mid love triangle and a whodunit murder everyone guessed 10 MINUTES IN! This movie lacked in ALL the genres that it tried to be a part of. Triggered that this movie was over two hours long and the murder probably took up only 10 minutes of it. This is the slowest movie I've ever watched in my entire LIFE.

Name: Missing
Review:
Apple ad, but I'm not that mad about it. 

I got suspicious after they took 30 seconds out of the movie to show how inconvenient Android users were. It was a scene when the girl tried to Facetime the housekeeper, housekeeper says he doesn't have an Apple device, she sighs, and then uses 20 seconds within the movie to go to the app store to download Whatsapp, and then continues with the story. I was like... huh??

Name: Spider-Man: Into the Spider-Verse
Review:
Jake Johnson's voice has that boyish-but-now-disgruntled-with-life twang that makes me want to hear him in any future renditions of Spiderman. He was so perfectly cast, I can't believe he hasn't been cast in more animations; his voice inflections are easy to read for kids but also has subtle (sassy!) cheekiness that makes it fun for older adults to listen to. ...Do I have a crush on Jake Johnson?

The soundtrack was great (the Chance the Rapper album cover in the bedroom is sooooo 2018). 

This is the most entertaining animation style I've seen. I'd love to see it being used in other genres besides the typical cartoon superhero stories (why don't we pretend all movies are just moving comic books?)- in other movies that deal with the multi-universe niche. I forever will be a fan of anything related to multi-universes.

Name: Spider-Man: Across the Spider-Verse
Review:
Dare I say.. may have been the perfect movie. 

Due to my strict rule of only fivers to tear jerkers- I can not make an exception for this movie and will keep my less than perfect rating.

Jackie Chan paved the way for superhero/vigilante action cartoon movies because THIS is how we should actually be doing every movie in the marvel universe. The stakes felt so much higher, the emotion so much deeper, and the intensity of the chase/fight/rescue scenes were so much more VIVID.¬†

ARE YOU SURE JOJI DIDN‚ÄôT SING ONE OF THE SONGS IN THE SOUNDTRACK? AND ARE YOU SURE IT WASN‚ÄôT KSI THAT VOICED SPIDER-PUNK??

Name: Saltburn
Review:
This movie was about to be a 4.5 until the last ten minutes, but even those last ten minutes weren‚Äôt terrible. What I‚Äôm saying is it would have been a whole lot more interesting if we had watched these deaths play about and THEN guess whose fault was it? And not have some evil mastermind behind it. Was it Farleigh‚Äôs fault for pushing Oliver over to want to overpower Felix‚Äôs family who then went on to lie about his family and then get Felix to be mad at him and just do more drugs? Was it Felix‚Äôs fault that he did so many drugs that night that he died accidentally and his sister fell as well? Before the last ten minutes, I was under the premise that it was gonna be like that riddle about the woman, husband, ferry operator, and rapist. The one where a woman wants to go visit her husband who lives far away from her and then gets turned down by the ferry operator for not having the 3x amount of the ticket price who then walks down the street and gets raped and murdered- whose fault is it for the woman‚Äôs death?
